## Example 1: Basic for loop to print values

```{r}
for (i in 1:5) {
  print(paste("This is iteration", i))
}
```

## Example 2: Using a for loop to fill a vector

```{r}
squares <- vector("numeric", length=5)   # create an empty numeric vector

for (i in 1:5) {
  squares[i] <- i^2
}

squares
```

## Example 3: Using a for loop with an if-statement

```{r}
temps <- c(12, 18, 23, 5, 30)

for (t in temps) {
  if (t > 20) {
    print(paste(t, "is warm"))
  } else {
    print(paste(t, "is cool"))
  }
}
```
